content.question: A gas mixture at <math alttext="0 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="1.0 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> contains <math alttext="0.010 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.010</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="H 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="0.015 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.015</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="0.025 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.025</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="N 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Assuming ideal behavior, what is the partial pressure of hydrogen gas <math alttext="H 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>(H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> in the mixture?

choices.label: About <math alttext="0.010 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.010</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because there is <math alttext="0.010 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.010</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="H 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the sample.

About <math alttext="0.050 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.050</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because there is <math alttext="0.050 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.050</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of gases at <math alttext="0 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="1.0 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

About <math alttext="0.20 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="H 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> comprises <math alttext="20 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the total number of moles of gas.

About <math alttext="0.40 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.40</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the mole ratio of <math alttext="H 2, to, O 2, to, N 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>:O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="0.4, to, 0.6 to 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.4</mn><mo>:</mo><mn>0.6</mn><mo>:</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: About <math alttext="0.20 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="H 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> comprises <math alttext="20 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the total number of moles of gas.

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
